revisions.rev:
{{Infobox person |image = <!-- only free-content images are allowed for depicting living people. Non-free and "fair use" images, e.g. promo photos, CD/DVD covers, posters, screen captures, etc., will be deleted - see [[WP:NONFREE]] --> | |imagesize = | | name = Frances Barber | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1958|5|13|df=yes}} | birth_place = [[Wolverhampton]], [[Staffordshire]], England | spouse = | partner = | children = | years_active = | occupation = Actress }} '''Frances Barber''' (born on 13 May 1958 in [[Wolverhampton]], [[Staffordshire]], England) is an [[Olivier Award]]-nominated English actress with a long and distinguished stage career. She has also appeared in numerous television productions. Her trademark is her husky voice.
==Personal life== Barber studied Drama at [[Bangor University]], where she was a contemporary of director [[Danny Boyle]], who became her boyfriend.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/culture/2009/apr/21/portrait-of-artist-frances-barber | location=London | work=Guardian | title=Portrait of the artist: Frances Barber, actor | date=2009-04-21 | first=Laura | last=Barnett}}</ref>. One of her closest friends is the actor [[Ian McKellen|Sir Ian McKellen]], who funded a library in her name in India.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-1236644/Ive-men-Actress-Frances-Barber-having-heart-broken-times.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title='I've had it with men!' Actress Frances Barber on having her heart broken six times | date=2009-12-18 | first=Rebecca | last=Hardy}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thisislondon.co.uk/theatre/article-23424406-details/The+year+of+my+big+break/article.do |title=The year of my big break| Theatre |publisher=This is London |date= |accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref> In 2006, she received an Honorary Fellowship from the [[University of Wolverhampton]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wlv.ac.uk/default.aspx?page=10297 |title=Actress Frances Barber receives honorary award |publisher=Wlv.ac.uk |date=2006-08-21 |accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref>
==Recent career== ===Stage=== With [[Pet Shop Boys]], she starred in their musical ''[[Closer to Heaven]]'' in 2001 as well as guest singer for the song "Friendly Fire" on their 2006 live concert at the [[Mermaid Theatre]]. She also appeared alongside [[Ian McKellen]] and [[Roger Allam]] in the Old Vic's [[pantomime]] production of ''[[Aladdin]]'' over the 2005-06 Christmas season. She again starred with [[Ian McKellen]] in 2007 playing Goneril in [[Trevor Nunn]]'s production of ''[[King Lear]]'' and as Arkadina in [[Anton Chekhov|Chekhov's]] ''[[The Seagull]]'' with the [[Royal Shakespeare Company]] in [[Stratford-upon-Avon]] followed by a world tour throughout the year.<ref>[http://www.britishtheatreguide.info/news/RSCdoublepress.htm British Theatre Guide - RSC Double Press]</ref> They again performed the two plays in repertory at the [[New London Theatre]] on [[Drury Lane]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.britishtheatreguide.info/reviews/RSCseagullPF-rev.htm |title=The British Theatre Guide : Reviews - The Seagull (RSC at the New London Theatre) |publisher=Britishtheatreguide.info |date=2008-01-12 |accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.britishtheatreguide.info/reviews/RSClearPF-rev.htm |title=The British Theatre Guide : Reviews - King Lear (RSC at the New London Theatre) |publisher=Britishtheatreguide.info |date=2008-01-12 |accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref> opening in November 2007 and closing mid-January 2008. She appeared in ''[[Madame de Sade]]'' opposite [[Judi Dench]] and [[Rosamund Pike]] at the [[Wyndham's Theatre]], and will soon be appearing opposite [[Niall Buggy]] in [[Brian Friel]]'s ''Afterplay'', in a celebration of the author's work.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eif.co.uk/news/cast-announced-afterplay |title=Cast announced for Afterplay | Edinburgh International Festival |publisher=Eif.co.uk |date=2009-07-20 |accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref>
===Television=== Barber is a regular face on British television; she recently guest starred in the spring 2007 season of the BBCs ''[[Hustle (TV series)|Hustle]]'', reprised her role as Goneril in the [[King Lear (2008 TV film)|2008 TV film of ''King Lear'']]. In 2008, she appeared as Mrs Prentice in the BBC sitcom ''[[Beautiful People (UK TV series)|Beautiful People]]'' and Nancy in ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]''. In 2011, she guest-starred in the ''[[Doctor Who]]'' episode ''[[A Good Man Goes to War]]'' as the sinister Madame Kovarian. <ref>http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/b011rf7y/Doctor_Who_Series_6_A_Good_Man_Goes_to_War/</ref> She also made brief appearances leading up to this in the Series Six episodes, ''[[Day of the Moon]]'', ''[[The Curse of the Black Spot]]'', ''[[The Rebel Flesh]]'' and ''[[The Almost People]]''. Barber returned to Doctor Who in the last few minutes of episode 12. She also appeared in episode 13.
==Theatre career== *''[[Ooh La La (play)|Ooh La La]]'' ([[Hull Truck Theatre]], 1979) *''[[Riff Raff Rules]]'' ([[Theatre Royal, Stratford East]]) *''[[Space Ache]]'' ([[Tricycle Theatre, Wakefield, 1980]]) *[[Emilia (Shakespeare)|Emilia]] in ''[[Othello]]'' ([[Oxford Playhouse]]) *''[[La Guerra (play)|La Guerra]]'' (''The Battle''), ''[[Desperado Corner]]'' and ''[[Madame Louise]]'' ([[Citizens Theatre|Glasgow Citizens']], 1980, and [[Venice Biennale|Venice Biennale Festival]], 1981) *''[[The Treat]]'' ([[Institute of Contemporary Arts]]) *''[[The Mission (play)|The Mission]]'' ([[Soho Poly]]) *''[[Hard Feelings]]'' (Oxford Playhouse and [[The Bush (theatre)|The Bush]], 1983) <ref>http://www.bushtheatre.co.uk/productions/hard_feelings.html</ref> *''[[Turning Over]]'' (The Bush, 1983) <ref>http://www.bushtheatre.co.uk/productions/turning_over.html</ref> *Marguerite in ''[[The Lady of the Camellias|Camille]]'' ([[Royal Shakespeare Company]], [[The Other Place]], 1984, and [[Comedy Theatre]], 1985 - [[Laurence Olivier Awards|Olivier]] nomination for Most Promising Newcomer) *[[Ophelia (character)|Ophelia]] in ''[[Hamlet]]'' (RSC [[Barbican Theatre]], 1985) *''[[Love's Labours Lost]]'' (RSC [[The Other Place (theatre)|The Other Place]], [[Comedy Theatre]], 1985) *''[[The Dead Monkey]]'' (RSC [[The Pit (theatre)|The Pit]], 1986)) *''[[Summer and Smoke]]'' ([[Haymarket Theatre (Leicester)|Haymarket Theatre]]) *Viola in ''[[Twelfth Night]]'' (Renaissance, [[Riverside Studios]], 1987) *Lady Macbeth in ''[[Macbeth]]'' ([[Royal Exchange, Manchester]], 1988) *''[[My Heart's a Suitcase]]'' ([[Royal Court Theatre|Royal Court]], 1990) *''[[Over a Barrel]]'' ([[Watford Palace Theatre]]) *''[[Imagine Drowning]]'' ([[Hampstead Theatre]], 1991) *Maxine Faulk in ''[[The Night of the Iguana]]'' ([[Royal National Theatre|National Theatre]], 1992) *[[Eliza Doolittle]] in ''[[Pygmalion (play)|Pygmalion]]'' (National Theatre, 1992) *''[[Insignificance (play)|Insignificance]]'' ([[Donmar Warehouse]], 1995) *''[[Uncle Vanya]]'' ([[Minerva Theatre]], [[Chichester]] and [[Albery Theatre]], 1996 - [[TMA Award]]) *''[[Closer (play)|Closer]]'' ([[Lyric Theatre (London)|Lyric Theatre]], National Theatre [[West End theatre|West End]] transfer, 1998) *''[[Closer to Heaven]]'' ([[Arts Theatre]],2001) *Valerie in ''[[Tales from the Vienna Woods#Play|Tales from the Vienna Woods]]'' (National Theatre, 2003) *Nurse Ratched in ''[[One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (play)|One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest]]'' ([[Gielgud Theatre]], 2004) *Dim Sum in ''[[Aladdin]]'' (Old Vic pantomime, 2005) *The Narrator in [[Shane Cullinan]]'s ''The Pieta'' [[St Paul's, Covent Garden]], 2006) *Cleopatra in ''[[Antony and Cleopatra]]'' ([[Shakespeare's Globe]], London, 2006) <ref>{{cite web|author=John Thaxter |url=http://www.thestage.co.uk/reviews/review.php/13153/antony-and-cleopatra |title=The Stage / Reviews / Antony and Cleopatra |publisher=Thestage.co.uk |date=2006-07-06 |accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref> *Arkadina in ''[[The Seagull]]'' and Goneril in ''[[King Lear]]'' (RSC, [[The Courtyard Theatre]] [[Stratford-upon-Avon]], and [[New London Theatre]], 2007) *''Madame de Sade'' (Donmar West End, [[Wyndham's Theatre]], 2009) *''[[Afterplay (play)|Afterplay]]'' ([[Edinburgh Festival]], then [[Gate Theatre|Gate Theatre, Dublin]], 2009)
==Select filmography== *''[[A Zed & Two Noughts]]'' (1985) *''[[Castaway (film)|Castaway]]'' (1986) *''[[Prick Up Your Ears]]'' (1987) *''[[Sammy and Rosie Get Laid]]'' (1987) *''[[Behaving Badly (TV serial)|Behaving Badly]]'' (1989) (TV) *''[[Red Dwarf]]'' - "[[Polymorph (Red Dwarf episode)|Polymorph]]" (1989) (TV) *''The Leaving of Liverpool'' (1992) *''[[Giorgino]]'' (1994) *''[[Space Precinct]]'' (1995) (TV) *''[[A Royal Scandal]]'' (1996) (TV) *''[[The Ice House (novel)|The Ice House]]'' (1997) (TV) *''[[Still Crazy]]'' (1998) *''[[Murder Most Horrid]]'' (1998) *''[[Bremner, Bird and Fortune]]'' (1999) (TV) *''[[Manchild]]'' (2002) (TV) * ''Flyfishing'' (2002) (TV) *''[[My Family (series 4)|My Family]]'' - "Owed to Susan" (as Vanessa, 2003) (TV) *''[[Boudica (film)|Boudica]]'' (2003) *''[[Monkey Dust]]'' (2003) (TV) (voice) *''[[Evilenko]]'' (2004) *''[[The IT Crowd]]'' - "Aunt Irma Visits" (2005) (TV) *''[[Funland]]'' (2005) (TV) *''[[Hustle (TV series)|Hustle]]'' (2007) (TV) *''[[King Lear (2008 film)|King Lear]]'' (2008) *''[[Beautiful People (UK TV series)|Beautiful People]]'' (2008) *''[[The Fattest Man in Britain]]'' (2009) *''[[The Royal]]'' (2009-) *''[[Doctor Who]]'' - 8 episodes "[[Victory of the Daleks]]" (2010), "[[Day of the Moon]]", "[[The Curse of the Black Spot]]", "[[The Rebel Flesh]]", "[[The Almost People]]", "[[A Good Man Goes to War]]", "[[Closing Time]]", "[[The Wedding of River Song]]"(2011) *''[[Friday Night Dinner]]'' (2011)
